description:
You are Belgian?

The Webmission is meeting the Belgians in SF!
Come & Join us ...

We are organizing a special Belgian Meetup in San Francisco in May 2010, Monday May 17th. All Belgians are welcome (entrepreneurs, students, bloggers, journalists,..)

Please HELP US to spread the news, INVITE friends.
It's a networking event, so more we are more we will have fun!

--

http://webmission.be...
http://twitter.com/we...
name: The Webmission is meeting the Belgians in SF!

description:
We will be running a Belgian startups presentation at the SF New Tech on Tuesday May 18th 2010.

We are a group of entrepreneurs, bloggers, journalists, developers and Tech enthusiasts from Belgium that have joined forces to promote the many good ideas and projects that are brewing in the country.

Five startups presenting & free tacos. Here are discount codes!
http://belgiansareback-rss.eventbrite.com/
25 tickets are 10% off with the code: 18may-isnoozed
25 tickets are 25% off with the code: 18may-whatadeal
25 tickets are 50% off with the code: 18may-yeahbaby
25 tickets are 100% off with the code: 18may-seeyouthere

And 2 minutes video of last year event
The belgians are coming!
http://sfnewtech.com/
name: THE Belgians are back in San Francisco!
how_to_find_us: Cross street is 15th. Look for the big black doors!

description:
Special Belgian Meetup in San Francisco next May

The biggest and greatest Belgian entrepreneurs dinner in the Bay Area! 

All Belgians, Dutch, French are welcome: entrepreneurs, Angels, geeks, students, bloggers, journalists,..

HELP US spread the event, INVITE your Belgian's friends!!

 

Food and drinks offered by Brussels Capital and IBBT
name: Webmission dinner, meeting the Belgians in the Bay Area

description:
The Belgians are back.

An awesome evening of Belgian Tech!

We will be running a Belgian startups presentation next May at the local startups scene to promote the many good ideas and projects that are brewing in the country.

Book your seat http://webmissionsfnewtech.eventbrite.com
name: Belgian startups pitch & demo

description: For those still in town: I'm going to check out some wine bars in SF on saturday evening, feel free to join! Other non-webmission people welcomed as well of course (Founder Institute, SFnewtech...)
name: let's have a wine bar tour in SF

description:
One month ago, we were busy promoting Belgian Entrepreneurship in the Valley. Now, we are back and the participants are happy to share their stories and benefits they got from the trip. 

We are inviting all the previous participants from the 2009, 2010 and 2011 webmissions and everyone that has any interest for the Webmission.

If you have questions, want to participate at the Webmission 2012 and wondering what's the return, you are more than welcome this Wednesday June 15th at 7pm!

 

Please, be our ambassadors by spreading the event : <a>http://www.meetup.com/webmission</a>;

 

Part I: Post webmission meetup, Pre-webmission 2012

Starting 7pm

Meetup is held at "Apero de la COM" at Seed Factory

We have booked a private room for webmission meetup. 

Free beers at the event thanks to Café Numérique.

Subscription Mandatory: http://www.cafenumerique.be/TZY

 

Part II: Webmission Party

Starting 9pm

After the meetup, we will all move to Rich Resto Bar & Lounge to celebrate the Webmission Party (see next meetup).

venue.name: Apero de la COM @ Seed Factory

name: Post webmission meetup
Webmission Party

description:
If you want to know more about the Webmission and the Silicon House Program let's meet this Tuesday with old Webmission members.

It has been a tradition every year since 2009 to bring to San Francisco a group of Belgian entrepreneurs to visit the hottest startups in the Bay Area, meet successful entrepreneurs and pitch to the local crowd. Following the first WebMission a large flock of Belgians have set their roots in the US and launched great startups like Storify, Checkthis, Twitspark and we’ve heard that there is more to come.

This year the WebMission will be preceded by a special program at the SiliconHouse in Mountain View organised by Paul Stasse and Tanguy Peers (only 8 places available, 2800€ participation fee), and will also take place at the same time than the Mission Princière. We are restricting the application to 25 participants with a small commitment fee up to the participant to support the organisation.

The WebMission will take place the first week of June starting on the 3rd. The program is not finalised yet and will evolve depending on the suggestions we get from the participants, you can have a look at the previous trips to get a better idea of what a typical WebMission in San Francisco looks like.

If you’d like to help in the organisation drop us an email at [masked]

If you are interested in the SiliconHouse program check our dedicated page for this event

If you are interested in joining the WebMission 2013 in SF, apply here
name: Meetup Webmission at la Mirabelle (ixelles)

description:
If you want to know more about the Webmission 2013 in SF and the Silicon House Program let's meet this Thursday with Webmission alumni during the Belgian screening of the documentary "The Startup Kids" in Louvain-la-neuve (hosted by Café Numérique, Nest'Up, RueDuWeb).

It's an amazing movie on the lives of inspiring entrepreneurs of Dropbox, Vimeo, Soundcloud, Playfish, Scribd, Kiip and other start-up of the Web, produced by two Icelandic entrepreneurs to motivate young people to become entrepreneurs and meet and learn from other entrepreneurs around the world.

Few spots left for the movie, book your seat here http://startupheroes.eventbrite.com


 

It has been a tradition every year since 2009 to bring to San Francisco a group of Belgian entrepreneurs to visit the hottest startups in the Bay Area, meet successful entrepreneurs and pitch to the local crowd. Following the first WebMission a large flock of Belgians have set their roots in the US and launched great startups like Storify, Checkthis, Twitspark and we’ve heard that there is more to come.

The WebMission will take place the first week of June starting on the 3rd. The program is not finalised yet and will evolve depending on the suggestions we get from the participants, you can have a look at the previous trips to get a better idea of what a typical WebMission in Silicon Valley looks like.

This year the WebMission will be preceded by a special program at the SiliconHouse in Mountain View organised by Paul Stasse and Tanguy Peers (only 8 places available, 2800€ participation fee), and will also take place at the same time than the Mission Princière. We are restricting the application to 25 participants with a small commitment fee up to the participant to support the organisation.

 

If you are interested in the SiliconHouse program check our dedicated page for this event

If you are interested in joining the WebMission 2013 in SF, apply here
name: Meetup Webmission @ the Belgian screening of the movie "Startups Kids" in LLN

description:

description:
Let's meet on Monday June 3rd 6:30pm and talk Tech Startups!

The first 60 Belgian beers ordered at the bar are on us :)

 

Signup, spread the word. Looking forward to see you!

The hashtag is #webmission

 

All the very best,

The Webmission Team.

 

EDIT:

For those who want to eat during the Webmission drink at the Cigar Bar & Gril, we will have to reserve it in advance.

We need your response before this friday 18h (GMT+2) 9AM (PST)!

You can reserve it with this doodle: http://doodle.com/iqh2cpu6ubc4tqd3 (Participation count as engagement)

The price will be 45$ per person in cash.
name: Webmission Drink (Tech Entrepreneurs), Monday June 3rd 6:30pm (San Francisco)

description:
Come on down & see what the Belgians are brewing!

We will have pizza's and refreshments.

Free beers and food!

 

6:30pm - 7pm - Social time, and food

7pm - 8pm - 5 minutes pitches from the Belgian's

startups followed by Q&A

8pm - 9pm - More social time

 

Patrick Eischen

http://selinko.com

Selinko offers brand protection services both physical and on-line to fight effectively against counterfeiting. We have the first secured and integrated platform to give each object a unique identity which can be verified by everyone. This identity allows us to offer unique direct marketing and online sales services

 

Vincenzo Ruggiero

https://postponeapp.com

Everyday, my first task is to manage my tasks list... The Reality? Everybody postpone things. Everyday. We created the most effective tool for that.
"Keep your to-do list short, useful and motivating."

 

Thibaut Dehem

http://87seconds.com

87 Seconds is the magic length when communicating

We create catchy explanation videos for your corporate communication needs. This includes a company presentation, a product demo, a tutorial video, an infographic video or just any communication.What makes us special is our unique platform helping you with your video brief creation. It allows for close collaboration with our designers, making your video affordable.

87seconds.com platform will be officially launched during SF'13. Take the chance for a demo!

 

Stijn Hanssens

http://co-scale.com

Our monitoring tool helps business critical web applications improve performance and reduce cost by revealing issues undetectable by other monitoring solutions

Jean-Christophe Cuvelier

http://pictawall.com

Pictawall is a live broadcasting of any photos & videos shared by the events' participants on social networks. 
It offers a new media for advertising and sponsorship by prominently displaying brands during events as these are integrated within the live stream of pictures & videos. 
Pictawall delivers more fun to the participants, and automatically increases the visibility on social networks during and after the events.
name: (Belgian) Webmission Tech Pitch Night, Tuesday June 4 at 6:30pm (San Francisco)

description:
Webmission's Home Run is a new initiative to fill the gap between abroad missions and local gatherings: Discover one startup in its own environment, what they do, their next steps, their challenges. Share experiences in a casual atmosphere so everybody can learn from others.

For this first edition we will meet Teammate, a startup born 3 months ago during a stay in the Silicon House in Mountain View.

A perfect match to address two topics! François will talk about the Why and how The Silicon Valley, and The first steps of his new startup.

François Dispaux (linkedIn - Twitter - Checkthis) is a belgian entrepreneur, born architect, living as a designer and coder. François is the Co-founder of Speculoos (design agency), Nectil (webapp agency), and by Layers (kids fashion & production design, editor of the Crapaks brand).


In the beginning of 2013, François joined the Webmission SF 2013 and the Mission Princière. But after several one-week trips in the Valley (his first experience of the Webmission in 2011 was awesome!), he felt that to really understand how the Valley works, he had to stay at least one month. François then jumped at the chance to join the Silicon House program and stayed in the valley from May 13 to June 9.


The Silicon House is a one-of-a-kind program for entrepreneurs to discover the Silicon Valley. François will share with you his experience of the program, why he joined after several trips to the Valley, how it works, what happened, and what was the benefits of living one month in Mountain View. See François' journey in 28 posters on Checkthis!

During his stay in Silicon House, François started his new venture, Teammate, had the opportunity to exchange opinions at various events and to gauge interest from experienced entrepreneurs.  

Teammate is the Dropbox for your projects. Teammate is a collaborative network which enables the projects in the very heart of the teammates' environment and provides better user engagement and enhanced collaboration. François will share with you the vision of Teammate, how it all begins in the Silicon Valley, what is the current status, what are the next steps, …

François is also looking for co-founders! If you are interested, DO NOT HESITATE A SECOND, you will be at the right place, at the right time!


--
This meetup is limited to 20 participants. If you are not able to join us, please unsubscribe as soon as possible so members in the waiting list will be able to join us!
name: Webmission's Home Run #1

description:
After an impressive WebMission in San Francisco we are going to Singapore end of November 2013 ! If you want to know more about the Webmission to Singapore let's meet on next Thursday October 10th with Webmission alumni in Brussels.

Agenda:

1. Welcome 

2. What's a Webmission ? 

3. Why Singapore ?

4. Program to Singapore  

5. Q&A


If you are interested in joining the WebMission 2013 in Singapore, apply here.
name: Meetup Webmission to Singapore (at La Mirabelle, Elsene/Ixelles)

description:
Join us on Thursday October 17th with Webmission alumni in Brussels to learn more about the program to Singapore. A special guest, Xavier Damman, Storify co-founder, acquired recently by LiveFyre will join us for this 2nd homerun edition. He's also among the first, with Laurent Eschenauer and Antoine Perdaens, to launch ​​the Webmission in 2009. He will share his experience overseas. 

Agenda:

• Welcome 

• What's a Webmission ?

• Why Singapore ? 

• Xavier Damman Speech (Storify)

• Q&A

If you are interested in joining the WebMission 2013 in Singapore, apply here.
name: Webmission's Home Run #2 with Xavier Damman (Storify)

description:
Join us on October 30 with Webmission alumni in Brussels to learn more about the program to Singapore. An insider, Fabian Tilmant, living in The Philippines since last year and Mentor in the First Startup Program of the archipelago will share with us insights from Asia for this 3rd homerun edition. Fabian was part of the Webmission to the Silicon Valley in 2011 and is helping the team meeting with the most inspiring startups, investors and incubators in Singapore.

He will share about his experience mentoring 10 local startups, cultural and economic insights about the region and opportunities for startups while in Singapore.
name: Experience sharing of 1 year in Asia with Fabian TILMANT

description:
Come on down and meet the Belgians at the HUB! We'll have some beers and talk Tech startups. 2 free drinks offered and appetizers.    

The Webmission is a delegation of Belgian Tech Entrepreneurs that travel abroad to promote their companies by increasing their international network and business opportunities. The Webmission is organized by and for the Belgian entrepreneurs.

                        

The HUB Singapore is a home for people who want to use entrepreneurial ideas to create sustainable impact. It is a curator of spaces, community and content for inspiration, action and collaboration.


                           

Signup, spread the word. Looking forward to see you!

The hashtag is #webmission

All the very best, The Webmission Team.

With the support of our main sponsors
name: Belgian Drink: Let's talk Tech Startups!

description:
Experience sharing of the webmission in Singapore.

Singapore might be a great destination for you, come to listen to the participants! 

We will talk about the why and how Singapore. We will share about our experience, cultural and economic insights about the region and opportunities for startups. 

With:

• Amélie De Spot, Managing Director, Internet Attitude (based in Singapore)

• François-Xavier Bellot, Entrepreneur, Auctelia (Participant)


• Geoffroy Verney-Carron, Entrepreneur, TimePlazza (Participant)


• Antoine Perdaens, Entrepreneur, Knowledge Plaza (Organizer Webmission)

Signup & spread the word. Looking forward to see you!

Thanks to ICAB - Business & Technology Incubator for hosting us !
name: Homerun: Post Singapore

description:
2014 is already in full swing. And unless you're totally out of touch with our social media accounts, you already know that we have 2 Webmissions cooking for you! 

First of all, we'll head West, to San Francisco and this will happen next June (22nd to 27th). Our program is in prep mode, but just have a look: Frontback, Rackspace, Geekdom, Everlane, Showpad, Engagor, Radionomy, OpenErp, Voxbone, Livefyre / Storify, Fenwick & West (Law Firm), ... Promising, isn't it? 

Then, this automn, we will travel back to Singapore where the local government recently announced new measures to turn the country into an innovator's heaven. 

So, it's time to get real!


•  Are you interested in participating in a Webmission, but don't know what it's about? 

• Are you already registered but have questions regarding the coming trip? - Are you curious about this year program? 

• Wanna know more about any possible help you can get? 

So, join us on Tuesday May 6th @ CO.STATION !  

If you are interested to join a WebMission in 2014, apply here.
name: Join a Webmission in 2014 (Information Meetup in Brussels)
